    • fitting RelDists distributions with gamlss

    fitting RelDists distributions with gamlss

    Jaime Mosquera & Johan Marin

    2019-08-19

    fittingDistributions.Rmd

    This is a temporal vignette, only for some tests

    Random data generation with EW family:

    require(RelDists)
## Loading required package: RelDists
## Loading required package: gamlss
## Loading required package: splines
## Loading required package: gamlss.data
## 
## Attaching package: 'gamlss.data'
## The following object is masked from 'package:datasets':
## 
##     sleep
## Loading required package: gamlss.dist
## Loading required package: MASS
## Loading required package: nlme
## Loading required package: parallel
##  **********   GAMLSS Version 5.1-4  **********
## For more on GAMLSS look at http://www.gamlss.org/
## Type gamlssNews() to see new features/changes/bug fixes.
## Loading required package: stringr
## <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<   RelDists Version 1.0.0  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
## Feel free to report bugs in https://github.com/ousuga/RelDists/issues
y <- rEW(n=100, mu=2, sigma=1.5, nu=0.5)

    Fitting with traditional gamlss families:

    require(gamlss)
fits <- fitDist(y, type="realplus")
fits$fits
##       EXP       WEI      WEI3      WEI2        GA  PARETO2o   PARETO2 
##  20.02357  21.58390  21.58390  21.58390  21.81566  22.02377  22.02384 
##        GP        GG       GIG     BCCGo       GB2      BCTo      BCPE 
##  22.02457  22.97470  23.78168  24.05292  24.91029  24.91612  25.06784 
##     BCPEo     LOGNO    LOGNO2        IG    IGAMMA 
##  25.06784  44.76669  44.76669 108.44656 126.00064
fits$failed
## [[1]]
## [1] "BCCG"
## 
## [[2]]
## [1] "exGAUS"
## 
## [[3]]
## [1] "LNO"
## 
## [[4]]
## [1] "BCT"

    Fitting with gamlss some our families:

    require(gamlss)
require(RelDists)

familias <- c("EW", "ExW", "FWE")

md <- gamlss(y~1, control=gamlss.control(n.cyc=500, trace=FALSE), family=NULL)
fits <- chooseDist(md, type = "extra",  extra = familias)
## minimum GAIC(k= 2 ) family: ExW 
## minimum GAIC(k= 3.84 ) family: ExW 
## minimum GAIC(k= 4.61 ) family: ExW
fits
##             2      3.84      4.61
## EW   22.99758  28.51758  30.82758
## ExW  22.94656  28.46656  30.77656
## FWE 102.99516 106.67516 108.21516

    Fitting with gamlss families and our "reldists" family:

    require(gamlss)
require(RelDists)
fits <- fitDistPlus(y, type="reldists")

fits$fits
fits$failed
